edu.ncsu.csc316.rentals.list

Class ArrayList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.rentals.list.ArrayList<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - Specifies that the ArrayList can contain any object type

    public class ArrayList<E extends java.lang.Comparable<E>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A custom implemented array list class that is able to adjust size automatically, elements can be added to the front, end or middle. Duplicate elements in the array are automatically rejected form the ArrayList.
    Author:
    Noah Benveniste, further edits made by Noah Benveniste for HumanResourcesManager, Kevin Hildner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int numArrayGrowths
      The number of times the growArray() method is called; used for performance analysis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ArrayList()
      Constructs an empty ArrayList of size zero with an initial capacity of ten

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(E element)
      Appends an element to the end of the list
      void add(int idx, E element)
      Adds a desired element to the ArrayList at a specified index, right-shifting necessary values
      E get(int idx)
      Gets an element at a specified index
      void quickSort()
      Sorts the list in ascending order
      E remove(int idx)
      Removes an element from the ArrayList at a specified index, left-shifting all remaining elements and returning the removed element
      E set(int idx, E element)
      Overwrites the element at a specified index with a new element
      int size()
      Getter for the size field

      • ArrayList

        public ArrayList()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(int idx,
                E element)
        Adds a desired element to the ArrayList at a specified index, right-shifting necessary values
        Parameters:
        idx - the zero-based index to add the new element at
        element - the element to add to the ArrayList
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the added element is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is less than zero or greater than the ArrayList's size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the added element is a duplicate of an element already in the list

      • add

        public void add(E element)
        Appends an element to the end of the list
        Parameters:
        element - the element to add

      • remove

        public E remove(int idx)
        Removes an element from the ArrayList at a specified index, left-shifting all remaining elements and returning the removed element
        Parameters:
        idx - indicates the index of the element to remove from the ArrayList
        Returns:
        the removed element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is out of bounds

      • set

        public E set(int idx,
             E element)
        Overwrites the element at a specified index with a new element
        Parameters:
        idx - the index in the array that is being over written
        element - the new value/object for that position in the array
        Returns:
        the old element at the specified index
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the added element is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is less than zero or greater than the ArrayList's size
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the added element is a duplicate of an element already in the list

      • get

        public E get(int idx)
        Gets an element at a specified index
        Parameters:
        idx - the index of the element to get
        Returns:
        the element at the specified index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is out of bounds

      • size

        public int size()
        Getter for the size field
        Returns:
        the size of the ArrayList i.e. how many elements it contains

      • quickSort

        public void quickSort()
        Sorts the list in ascending order
